panels.description: Measures the time since the leader was last able to contact the follower nodes when checking its leader lease
panels.title: Consul Raft Leader LastContact

panels.content:
# CPU Utilisation

Encryption can place a heavy demand on CPU. If the CPU is too busy, Vault may have trouble keeping up with the incoming request load. You may also want to monitor each CPU individually to make sure requests are evenly balanced across all CPUs.

Consul is not particularly demanding of CPU time, but a spike in CPU usage might indicate too many operations taking place at once, and iowait_cpu is critical -- it means Consul is waiting for data to be written to disk, a sign that Raft might be writing snapshots to disk too often.
panels.title: CPU Utilisation

panels.description: Percentage of CPU being used by user processes on Consul servers (processes including Consul)
panels.title: Consul User CPU Usage

panels.description: Percentage of CPU time spent waiting for I/O tasks to complete. Look for iowait greater than 10%
panels.title: Consul CPU IOWait

panels.description: Percentage of CPU being used by user processes on Vault server (processes including Vault)
panels.title: Vault User CPU Usage

panels.description: Percentage of CPU time spent waiting for I/O tasks to complete. Look for iowait greater than 10%
panels.title: Vault CPU IOWait

panels.content:
# Memory Usage

## Consul
Consul keeps all of its data in memory. If Consul consumes all available memory, it will crash. You should also monitor
total available RAM to make sure some RAM is available for other processes, and swap usage should remain at 0% for best performance.

## Vault
Vault doesn't need as much memory as Consul, but if it does run out, it too will crash. You should also monitor total
available RAM to make sure some RAM is available for other processes, and swap usage should remain at 0% for best performance

### What to look for
If sys_bytes exceeds 90% of total_bytes, if mem.used_percent is over 90%, or if swap.used_percent is greater
than 0.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Percentage of physical memory in use
panels.title: Consul memory used percent

panels.description: Delta of Percentage of physical memory in use
panels.title: Consul memory used percent delta

panels.description: Percentage of physical memory in use
panels.title: Vault memory used percent

panels.description: Delta of Percentage of physical memory in use
panels.title: Vault memory used percent delta

panels.content:
# Network Utilisation

A sudden spike in network traffic to Vault might be the result of a misconfigured client causing too many requests, or additional load you didn't plan for. 

Look for sudden large changes to the net metrics (greater than 50% deviation from baseline).
panels.title: Network Utilisation

panels.description: Bits/second sent on each network interface
panels.title: Vault Network Traffic Sent

panels.description: Network traffic received on each network interface (bits/second)
panels.title: Vault Network Received (bits/second)

panels.description: Network traffic sent from each network interface (bits/second)
panels.title: Consul Network Sent (bits/second)

panels.description: Network traffic received on each network interface (bits/second)
panels.title: Consul Network Received (bits/second)

panels.content:
# File Descriptor Usage

Heavy utilisation of the network due to lots of connections can often cause high utilisation of file-descriptors. There are 2 metrics that should be monitored.

If the file-nr reaches 80% of the file-max then you should alert and investigate
panels.title: File Descriptor Usage

panels.description: Number of file handles being used across all processes on host as a percentage of total number of available file handles
panels.title: Vault File Descriptor Usage Percentage

panels.description: Number of file handles being used across all processes on host as a percentage of total number of available file handles
panels.title: Consul File Descriptor Usage Percentage

panels.content:
# Slow Consul Response Time - Vault
These metrics indicate how long it takes for Consul to handle requests from Vault
panels.title: Slow Consul Response Time - Vault
Upper Value of Operations against Consul Storage Backend

panels.content:
# Vault Write Ahead Logs Processing

The Vault write-ahead logs (WALs) are used to replicate Vault between clusters. Surprisingly, the WAL's are kept even if replication is not currently enabled. The WAL is purged every few seconds by a garbage collector. But if Vault is under heavy load, the WAL may start to grow, putting pressure on Consul.

* vault_wal_persist: WALs Amount of time required to persist the Vault write-ahead logs (WAL) to the Consul backend.
* vault_wal_flushReady: Amount of time required to flush the Vault write-ahead logs (WAL) to the persist queue

Look for flushReady over 500ms, or vault.wal.persist is over 1000ms.
panels.title: Vault WAL Processing

panels.description: Amount of time required to flush the Vault write-ahead logs (WAL) to the persist queue
panels.title: Vault WAL FlushReady

panels.description: WALs Amount of time required to persist the Vault write-ahead logs (WAL) to the Consul backend
panels.title: Vault WAL Persist

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul server becomes a leader
panels.title: Consul Raft State Leader

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul server starts an election
panels.title: Consul Raft State Candidate

panels.description: Tracks the overall health of the server cluster. If all servers considered healthy by Autopilot, this will be set to 1. If any are unhealthy, this will be 0.
panels.title: Consul Autopilot Healthy

panels.content:
# Consul Gabarge Collection

GC pause is a "stop-the-world" event, meaning that all runtime threads are blocked until GC completes. Normally these pauses last only a few nanoseconds. But if memory usage is high, the Go runtime may GC so frequently that it starts to slow down Consul.
panels.title: Consul Garbage Collection

panels.description: Number of nanoseconds consumed by stop-the-world garbage collection (GC) pauses since Consul started
panels.title: Consul Garbage Collection
